Interface_name: UDP based on Boost.Asio in C++
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a UDP server class using Boost.Asio that asynchronously receives datagrams and sends responses.

Class Description: The udp_server class implements a UDP server that listens for incoming datagrams on a specified port and responds with a daytime string. It uses Boost.Asio for asynchronous network operations.

Attributes:
- socket_: [boost::asio::ip::udp::socket] - The UDP socket used for communication
- remote_endpoint_: [boost::asio::ip::udp::endpoint] - Stores the endpoint of the last received message
- recv_buffer_: [std::array<char, 1>] - Buffer for receiving incoming datagrams

Methods:
- udp_server([boost::asio::io_context&] io_context) -> [void] - Constructor that initializes the UDP socket and starts listening
- start_receive() -> [void] - Begins asynchronous reception of UDP datagrams
- handle_receive([const boost::system::error_code&] error) -> [void] - Callback for handling received datagrams and sending responses
- handle_send([std::shared_ptr<std::string>] message) -> [void] - Callback for handling completed send operations
